alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 8:10AM PDT until May 12 at 12:18PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...Until early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 20.8 feet, Water covers part of Highway 21 near the intersection with Little Goosmus Creek Road between mile post 185 and 189. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM PDT Friday the stage was 18.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 AM PDT Friday was 18.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 20.8 feet late Sunday morning. It will then gradually fall below flood stage by early next Friday morning, May 12. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 20.9 feet on 06/01/1997, and a historic crest of 22.5 feet on 05/11/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 830 PM PDT.
